alert.note: Alert for Inland Broward County; Inland Palm Beach County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 20 at 7:27PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Broward and south central Palm Beach Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 727 PM EDT, National Weather Service meteorologists were tracking a strong thunderstorm capable of producing a landspout near Intersection Alligator Alley And Miami Canal, or 23 miles northwest of Pembroke Pines, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts, winds in excess of 40 mph, and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Intersection Alligator Alley And Miami Canal, Mile Marker 30 On Alligator Alley and West Broward Rec. Area On Alligator Alley. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors and report your sighting to the National Weather Service. This activity was also developing in an environment favorable for the formation of funnel clouds. Stay tuned to NOAA weather radio and local media for additional updates and possible warnings. Excessive cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Inland Broward County; Inland Palm Beach County
